official-title.#text:
To require Members of Congress to disclose delinquent tax
		  liability and to require an ethics inquiry into, and the garnishment of the
		  wages of, a Member with Federal tax liability.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

, for a period to be

			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee

short-title.#text:
Members of Congress Tax Accountability Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Amendment to the
			 Ethics in Government Act of 1978

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the
			 end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 102(a) of the
			 Ethics in Government Act of 1978

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the amount of any delinquent tax liability owed
				to the United States or any State or local government entity.

term.#tail:
means any tax liability which has been
				assessed and with respect to which all judicial and administrative remedies
				have been exhausted, or have
				lapsed.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 102(b)(1)(A) of the Ethics in Government Act of
			 1978
section 102(a)(9) of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Members of Congress Tax Accountability Act of 2013/s:2

text.#text:
If a Member of
			 Congress reports a delinquent tax liability on the Member’s annual disclosure
			 form required under

determining the
			 total delinquent tax liability of the Member;

determining the
			 reason the Member has incurred a delinquent tax liability;

determining
			 whether such delinquent tax liability has reflected poorly on Congress.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 102(a)(9) of the Ethics
			 in Government Act of 1978

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) shall, not later than 30
			 calendar days after filing the form, arrange with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Members of Congress Tax Accountability Act of 2013/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief Administrative Officer of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Chief Administrative Officer of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to have the Member’s salary
			 reduced by an amount appropriate to pay the taxes owed to the United States
			 within a reasonable time period.
